On Tuesday 24 June 2003 15:37, areider wrote:
> I spend my day (in vaj/wsad) writing small test snippets in a
> workspace which answer a result which I open in an inspector. For
> these tests, success is measured by what I see in the inspector.

I am not sure if I got you right here.
Why do you use that inspector? To /manually/ verify the /automated/ 
test did not fail? Collecting test results (whether tests fail or pass) 
is JUnit's job, not the tester's -- that's why it is an automated test.
You do use assertEquals and the like, do you?

> The other is
> simply the value of 'cataloging' and sharing these tests rather than
> having them ad hoc in a development workspace. 

I don't understand what you mean by cataloging.
Neither do I understand what bothers you about having tests in the 
development workspace. After all, tests belong to the development?

> But I dont have any source for junit.jar in the junit3.8.1.zip
> file I downloaded from junit.org (also sourceforge), else I'd have
> fixed this myself. Where do I find the source distro?

It's in src.jar in the JUnit directory.

Robert
